Position Description

At a Glance

 

Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Operations Engineering Intern to join the Electrical Wiring Systems Team in Mascoutah, IL. The Operations Engineering Intern will develop, implement, maintain, and improve manufacturing/ Logistics processes required to meet the needs of the operation for both existing and new processes. Assure processes support organizational goals for safety, quality, delivery, inventory, and cost.

 

What Will You Do?

  • Develop new, or improve existing, standard work for Production and Logistics operations.
  • Under supervision, utilize Lean manufacturing tools, such as Single-Piece Flow, 5-S, Visual Management Systems and Set Up Reductions.
  • Analyze production and logistics processes, and work with the management team to improve and standardize those processes.
  • Update existing standardize work to match latest changes.
  • Support plant safety culture with continuous improvement activities that will result in reduction of potential injuries.
  • Develop and implement appropriate metrics to measure and monitor plant's continuous improvement efforts.
  • Performs technical assignments of simple to moderate complexity under supervision.
  • Working independently or in a group setting as needed based on the assigned project.

Qualifications

Education: Pursuing a BS degree in Engineering (Mechanical/Manufacturing, Industrial or equivalent)

 

Preferred Skills:

  • Knowledge of manufacturing and distribution processes.
  • Commitment to health and safety standards.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Project management skills and Problem-solving ability
  • Understanding of lean manufacturing tools and concepts
  • Teamwork skills

Company Info

About Legrand

Legrand is the global specialist in electrical and digital building infrastructures. Our comprehensive offering of solutions for residential, commercial, and data center markets makes us a benchmark for customers worldwide. We harness technological and societal trends with lasting impacts on buildings with the purpose of improving life by transforming the spaces where people live, work, and meet with electrical and digital infrastructures and connected solutions that are simple, innovative, and sustainable. Legrand is a global, publicly traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR). For more information, visit www.legrandgroup.com/en

 

About Legrand North and Central America

Legrand, North & Central America (LNCA) is a leader in the AV, Lighting & Controls, Electrical, and Data Center markets. LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, as well as distinctive benefits like a high employer 401K match, paid time off (PTO) and holiday pay, short-term and long-term disability benefit plans, above-benchmark paid maternity and parental leave, bonus opportunities in accordance with the Company’s incentive plans, paid time off to volunteer, and an active/growing Employee Resource Group network. For more information, visit legrand.us 

 

 

About Legrand’s Electrical Wiring Systems Division

Legrand’s Electrical Wiring Systems (EWS) division provides the most complete line of residential, commercial, and industrial electrical wiring devices in the world.  Through commitment to innovation and quality, EWS maintains the position of industry leader in wire and cable management and wiring devices categories, specializing in raceways, flexible floor, open space and outdoor power solutions, wire mesh cable trays and systems, and designer switches and outlets. With this comprehensive offering, EWS serves a range of exciting vertical markets, including commercial office and commercial interior, data centers, education, healthcare, hospitality, manufacturing, mixed-use developments and residential.  For more information, visit legrand.us/electrical wiring devices
